page.title: 08MANUFACTURING INDUSTRY
page.content: Harefield's manufacturing is centred on the canal at Coppermill Lock.As early as the Seventeenth Century, industry using water power from the Colne located here.This site is now occupied by the Bell works, producing rubber equipment for industrial use.These works form the centre of a small cluster of firms. The factories have suffered during the 1980's economic recession.The Bell works responded to difficulties by short time working and proposed selling off land for housing.Cape Universal Claddings closed down their Harefield works and Croda Inks went into receivership.They were then taken over by Fishburn Inks, who have put some buildings up for sale and threaten redundancies.The more prosperous firms seem to be the small units based on workshops.
